title: [過唔到FFP要賣人還債]AC米蘭討論區 69

replies.msg:
Forza Milan

常見問題：
AC米蘭同國際米蘭又係有"米蘭"，應該點分？
ANS：AC米蘭簡稱米蘭，國際米蘭叫國米，避免稱呼做AC，因為AC係球會咁解，而milan先係名既簡稱。
AC米蘭仲係咪「老人院」？
ANS：現時全隊平均年齡為25歲。
今個轉會窗到目前為止簽咗咁多球員，遲啲仲會唔會有錢買人？
ANS：其實買球員好少會一炮過畀，多數都係分期，所以仲會有錢簽其他球員。
簽咗咁多球員會唔會過唔到FFP？
ANS：早前米蘭管理層有同UEFA探討經營計劃。
http://sempremilan.com/ts-fassone-meets-uefa-to-discuss-ac-milan-business-plan（By 二石四鳥)

Massimiliano Mirabelli has confirmed that Carlos Bacca will return to Milan, who will also look to sign ‘a top centre-forward’.

Mirabelli’s deals for Nikola Kalinic and Andre Silva last summer failed to make their desired impact, and the sporting director suggested they would be replaced by Bacca and another striker.

“Donnarumma? I don’t think it’s the right time to talk about figures,” he told Milan TV.

“We haven’t received any offers for Gigio and he hasn’t told us he wants to leave. For us, he’s an important asset. We renewed his contract a year ago.

“We want to keep him for a long time. He’s an important player for us. If he was to come and tell us he wanted out, a club must arrive with an appropriate offer.

“Attack? Cutrone will certainly stay. As for the formation, Gattuso will decide whether we start again from a 4-3-3. After that, there will be some tweaks.

“Bacca will return, we plan to change two strikers so we can sign a top centre-forward, plus a midfielder and a winger. The market? We can’t gamble, we need certainties.

“Milan invested so much last summer, but we couldn’t do everything in one transfer window. Now we have a base and we just have to make small adjustments.

“The number of players [we sign] depends on what UEFA will decide.”

UEFA makes FFP changes

UEFA has today announced new Financial Fair Play rules, with clubs required to publish their accounts, “including payments to agents”.

The executive committee of European football’s governing body met in Kiev today, and have announced reforms to FFP.

“The UEFA Executive Committee approved today the new edition of the Club Licensing and Financial Fair Play regulations to further strengthen the existing rules and to adapt to the ever-evolving environment of European football,” a statement confirmed.

“The new regulations will increase transparency with the obligation for clubs to publish their financial information, including payments to agents.

“Secondly, there will be improved harmonisation of financial and accounting reporting principles on football specific transactions, such as specific accounting requirements for the transfer of players.

“Thirdly, a more proactive approach in order to anticipate financial issues, by introducing a series of new financial indicators that will allow a stricter monitoring of clubs’ budgets by the CFCB.

“The indicators are: the sustainable debt ratio that will enhance the monitoring over the debt position of clubs and the player transfer deficit indicator that will enhance the monitoring on clubs transfer spending over a certain amount.”

Fassone comments after the board of directors meeting:
- “ 3-4 signings will arrive this summer regardless of UEFA’s decision.”
- “I hope to have given the clearest possible massages of absolute transparency.”
- “ The total capital increase is €40 million.”
- “This was a routine board meeting. We discussed UEFA’s decision, the capital increase and minor issues.”
- Fassone on UEFA’s decision: “It’s a complex decision mainly linked to the insecurity of the future of the company”
- “In the worst case scenario Milan will be excluded from the Europa League. In that case there will be a decrease in the budget of the transfer window.”
- “The refinancing of the debt to Elliot is simpler than made out to be.”
- “Considering the decision can be appealed, there will be 2 trials , 1 before mid-June, and one after.”
- Fassone: “There is no concern among the players. Their maturity is excellent.”

Alexandre Pato has issued a come-and-get-me plea to former club Milan. “I’m in love, so I couldn’t say no. If Gennaro Gattuso called…”

Pato scored 63 goals and won a Scudetto in six seasons with Milan and now plys his trade in China for Fabio Cannavaro’s Tianjin Quanjian, but the striker made it clear he would relish a return to San Siro.

“Seeing Milan like this is sad, but they need patience,” the 28-year-old told Gazzetta dello Sport.

“Their fans still have the team who won everything in their sights, but Milan have changed a lot and returning to the top can’t happen overnight.

“Playing in the Europa League again is a first step. Gattuso gave them a shock and his renewal was the right decision.

“Would I go back? They have Chinese owners and I like Italian football. I’m in love with Milan and the city, so I couldn’t say no.

“I still have a year-and-a-hald left on my contract, but never say never. If Gattuso calls me, I could recommend a striker to him...”

Bacca swap for Zaza?

Milan could use Valencia’s interest in Carlos Bacca to cut a deal on bringing Simone Zaza to San Siro, claim reports in Italy and Spain.

Bacca spent the season on loan at Villarreal, but the Yellow Submarine are not prepared to pay the €15.5m release clause.

He does not want a return to the Rossoneri and the feeling is mutual, but the Colombia international could be used as part of other transfer dealings.

According to Calciomercato.com, Valencia are interested in Bacca and could be prepared to take him on in exchange for Zaza to Milan.

Superdeporte in Spain and La Gazzetta dello Sport also fuel existing speculation about Milan’s attempt to bring Zaza to Serie A.

Bacca scored 18 goals with seven assists in 43 competitive games for Villarreal this season, but turns 32 in September and time is running out to find a suitable club.

Simone Zaza will be 27 next month and had his most prolific campaign at Valencia with 13 Liga goals, but still dropped down the pecking order.

Report: Li rejected Milan bid

Milan’s board are reportedly studying ways to oust the Chinese owners, as Yonghong Li is said to have rejected a €450m takeover bid.

The Rossoneri will be sanctioned by UEFA for Financial Fair Play, with the governing body deciding not to offer them a settlement agreement.

Both the club and owner are in debt to U.S hedge fund Elliott Management, who funded the Chinese takeover last April.

If the fund isn’t repaid by October, they can take control of the running of the club.

Today La Repubblica is reporting that Li rejected a €450m bid from Dubai, thought to be Mohamed Al-Falasi, which would have settled the Elliott debt.

Yonghong Li, Han Li, Lu Bo and Xu Renshuo, the Chinese board members, will not listen to offers below €750m for the Rossoneri.

As a result, CEO Marco Fassone met with Marco Patuano and Paolo Scaroni yesterday to study legal means of isolating the Chinese.

The club is therefore effectively split into two warring factions.

Bonucci: ‘Balotelli has changed’

Leonardo Bonucci insists Mario Balotelli has “changed, matured” and wants to be “a true example” as Italy captain.

The Azzurri face Saudi Arabia in a friendly tomorrow night, and as the most senior member of the squad the Milan centre-back will wear the armband.

“Being captain of the national team is definitely something you can feel,” Bonucci explained in today’s Press conference.

“There’s a strong sense of responsibility, but what surpasses everything is pride. I want to be a true example for the rest of lads, also Mario who among other things I’ve found changed, matured.

“It’s strange not to find [Daniele] De Rossi and [Gigi] Buffon here, teammates and above all friends for a lifetime. Sooner or later though we all have to say ‘enough’.

“I’ve felt it a bit, not laughing at Coverciano with Gigi and Daniele, but I learned a lot from the great champions of the recent past and I hope I can pass on the values I got from them.

“If Buffon came back? As always, he’d be an added value.”
